body_html:
@sbyma thanks for the help. Yes, it fix my problem. Just wondering two things:
First:
I got that warning in both computers, but even that i can make a distributed training.
Could not find channel for target: /job:prs/replica:0/task:0

Second:
I could not target directly to the gpus using:
with tf.device("/job:worker/task:0/gpu:1"):
Since In the second computer has 2 gpus and tensorflow create the devices with bazel i supposed that i can target directly to the gpu also change the gpu with device:gpu:0 ... 1 or device:0 and could not make run.
Any help. If it is possible send a pm, I will close the thread.

Regards

body:
@sbyma thanks for the help. Yes, it fix my problem. Just wondering two things:
First:
I got that warning in both computers, but even that i can make a distributed training.
`Could not find channel for target: /job:prs/replica:0/task:0`

Second:
I could not target directly to the gpus using: 
`with tf.device("/job:worker/task:0/gpu:1"):`
Since In the second computer has 2 gpus and tensorflow create the devices with bazel i supposed that i can target directly to the gpu also change the gpu with device:gpu:0 ... 1 or device:0 and could not make run. 
Any help. If it is possible send a pm, I will close the thread.

Regards
